task_summary: Pick up the bowl from the counter and place it inside the kitchen cabinet using the robot arm, as shown in the frames.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator is commanded to pick up a bowl resting on the kitchen counter and place it inside an open kitchen cabinet. The robot must perceive the bowl, approach and grasp it from above, lift and transport it to the position above the cabinet, then place it inside, and retreat. Visual cues in the episode indicate one-handed pick-and-place, no cabinet door manipulation, and the use of a top grasp strategy. Movement and gripper actions are sequenced for reliable transfer between surfaces.
preconditions: The bowl is clearly visible and accessible on the kitchen counter.
The kitchen cabinet is open and unobstructed.
stepwise_plan: Ensure the bowl is detected and locate it visually.
Open the gripper and move the end effector above the bowl.
Compute the grasp pose and align above the bowl.
Grasp the bowl from above and verify a stable grasp.
Move the bowl above the cabinet entry.
Place the bowl inside with a gentle press.
Retreat the arm from the cabinet.
success_criteria: The bowl is stably inside the kitchen cabinet.
No significant bowl spillage or tipping occurs.
The gripper is released and clear of the cabinet after placement.
failure_and_recovery: If the bowl is not visible, re-attempt visual scan.
If grasp fails, retry grasp procedure up to three times.
If the cabinet is not visible, perform a scan for it.
task_long_description.termination: Task completes once the bowl is placed in the cabinet, gripper is open, and robot has exited the cabinet.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Put the bowl inside the kitchen cabinet

node_specs.description: Check if the bowl is visible.
Scan for the bowl using a raster pattern.
Detect the precise pose of the bowl.
Open gripper wide enough for bowl acquisition/release.
Move end effector above bowl for pre-grasp.
Compute a top grasp pose for the bowl.
Approach and align end effector to the bowl with fine tolerance.
Execute top grasp at the computed pose.
Check if the bowl is securely held.
Check if the kitchen cabinet is visible.
Detect the pose of the kitchen cabinet.
Move end effector above the kitchen cabinet for placement.
Place bowl inside the cabinet with light force.
Retract end effector away from cabinet after placement.

recovery_strategy: Retry visual scan up to three times for bowl
Retry bowl grasp step if grasp unsuccessful
Retry visual scan for kitchen cabinet
assumptions: Frames show open cabinet; no container door manipulation performed.
Bowl is sufficiently visible for grasp from top.
Frames dominate over instruction for precise object locations.

expected_success_criteria: Bowl is inside cabinet without tipping
Gripper open and no longer in cabinet
